feed.title: WY Chow Lab
feed.subtitle: We use solid-state NMR spectroscopy to bring new insight to biomolecules in the extracellular matrix that are relevant to human health and disease. We are based at the University of Warwick, UK.

entry.title: Joining the lab through the ASCDT MSc+PhD route (UK/EU)

link.title: Joining the lab through the ASCDT MSc+PhD route (UK/EU)

entry.content:
The deadline for this route has passed on 15 August 2022. Please see the join page for current opportunities.

Interested in joining the lab?

A fully funded studentship (for UK/EU) is available through the Warwick Centre for Doctoral Training in Analytical Science (ASCDT) Msc + PhD route for October 2022 entry. In this 4-year programme, you will take a selection of courses and pick two mini-projects for the first year, which leads to the award of a MSc in Analytical Sciences. After that, you choose one of your mini-projects to continue for a PhD.

We are offering a project titled Developing a solid-state NMR approach to characterise coatings and scaffolds that support mammalian cell culture.

Description: Mammalian cell culture is an essential technology for biomedical research and development of personalized medicine. Cell growth and development are strongly influenced by the molecular structures present in the extracellular environment, which is provided currently by coatings, scaffolds and gels, which can show variation due to batch and preparation method. Better characterisation of the intact extracellular environment will enable the design of a new generation of materials to support mammalian cell culture for well-defined outcomes. In this mini-project, you will have the chance to learn solid-state NMR and other analytical and structural characterization techniques. You will apply these techniques to scaffolds and gels that you have prepared. Depending on interest, you may also produce samples by mammalian cell culture yourself, gaining a key skill for many areas of biotechnological industry in the process.

Other projects can be viewed at the ASCDT page for the MSc + PhD route. You can also find more information about the Analytical Science Centre for Doctoral Training (ASCDT).

Deadline: 15 August 2022

  • jobs.ac.uk listing
  • findaphd.com listing
entry.summary: The deadline for this route has passed on 15 August 2022. Please see the join page for current opportunities.

entry.title: Warwick Invisibleconf
entry.content: Ying spoke at the inVISIBLE research and diversity conference today. Her talk was titled “Using Solid-state NMR to Understand Biological Structures Essential to Multicellular Life”.
entry.summary: Ying spoke at the inVISIBLE research and diversity conference today. Her talk was titled “Using Solid-state NMR to Understand Biological Structures Essential to Multicellular Life”.

entry.title: Start Nmr First
entry.content: Ying ran her first solid-state NMR experiments at Warwick today. 千里之行，始於足下!
entry.summary: Ying ran her first solid-state NMR experiments at Warwick today. 千里之行，始於足下!

entry.title: Brussels Aku Workshop
entry.content: Ying was invited to speak at the 12th International Scientific Conference on AKU, hosted by the Alkaptonuria Society at the Vrije Universiteit Brussel (VUB). It was great to see old friends and meet new faces in Brussels.
entry.summary: Ying was invited to speak at the 12th International Scientific Conference on AKU, hosted by the Alkaptonuria Society at the Vrije Universiteit Brussel (VUB). It was great to see old friends and meet new faces in Brussels.

entry.title: Warwick Cmp Seminar
entry.content: Ying spoke at the departmental Condensed Matter Physics seminar. Her talk was titled “Biological structures in the extracellular context”.
entry.summary: Ying spoke at the departmental Condensed Matter Physics seminar. Her talk was titled “Biological structures in the extracellular context”.

entry.title: Start Appte
entry.content: Ying started the Academic and Professional Pathway for Teaching Excellence (APPTE) course today, a 12-month programme to develop teaching practice in higher education tailored to new academic staff at the University of Warwick.
entry.summary: Ying started the Academic and Professional Pathway for Teaching Excellence (APPTE) course today, a 12-month programme to develop teaching practice in higher education tailored to new academic staff at the University of Warwick.

entry.title: Warwick Bms Seminar
entry.content: Ying spoke at the Warwick Biomedical Science seminar. Her talk was titled “From a heavy mouse to human black cartilage: how solid-state NMR can give new insight on the extracellular matrix”.
entry.summary: Ying spoke at the Warwick Biomedical Science seminar. Her talk was titled “From a heavy mouse to human black cartilage: how solid-state NMR can give new insight on the extracellular matrix”.

entry.title: Start
entry.content: Ying started as an Assistant Professor at Warwick today.
entry.summary: Ying started as an Assistant Professor at Warwick today.
